name: WorldScannerBuilder
description: A powerful World Interaction builder in JSMacros that provides a fluent API for creating custom world scanners.
overview:
The `WorldScannerBuilder` class is a powerful World Interaction builder in JSMacros that provides a fluent API for creating custom world scanners. It allows you to build complex filters to find specific blocks and block states in the Minecraft world efficiently using native Java functions.

This builder is particularly useful for JavaScript and other languages that don't support multithreading natively, as it enables parallel processing of world scans that would otherwise run sequentially. The builder supports both string-based filters (for simple matching) and method-based filters (for complex logic).

The WorldScannerBuilder uses a fluent builder pattern with two main filter categories: Block Filters (based on block properties and methods) and Block State Filters (based on block state properties and methods). Each filter starts with a "with" command and can be combined using "and", "or", "xor" commands. The "not" command negates the entire filter.

methods.name: withBlockFilter
methods.description: Starts a new block filter using a method from BlockHelper.

parameters.name: method
parameters.description: The name of the method from BlockHelper to use for filtering.

examples:
// Filter blocks by their ID method
builder.withBlockFilter("getId");

methods.name: andBlockFilter
methods.description: Adds a new block filter with AND logic.

parameters.name: method
parameters.description: The name of the method from BlockHelper.

methods.name: orBlockFilter
methods.description: Adds a new block filter with OR logic.

parameters.name: method
parameters.description: The name of the method from BlockHelper.

methods.name: withStringBlockFilter
methods.description: Starts a new string-based block filter for simple text matching.

methods.name: andStringBlockFilter
methods.description: Adds a new string block filter with AND logic.

methods.name: orStringBlockFilter
methods.description: Adds a new string block filter with OR logic.

methods.name: withStateFilter
methods.description: Starts a new block state filter using a method from BlockStateHelper.

parameters.name: method
parameters.description: The name of the method from BlockStateHelper.

examples:
// Filter by block state opacity
builder.withStateFilter("getOpacity");

methods.name: andStateFilter
methods.description: Adds a new block state filter with AND logic.

parameters.name: method
parameters.description: The name of the method from BlockStateHelper.

methods.name: orStateFilter
methods.description: Adds a new block state filter with OR logic.

parameters.name: method
parameters.description: The name of the method from BlockStateHelper.

methods.name: notStateFilter
methods.description: Negates the current block state filter.

methods.name: withStringStateFilter
methods.description: Starts a new string-based block state filter.

methods.name: andStringStateFilter
methods.description: Adds a new string block state filter with AND logic.

methods.name: orStringStateFilter
methods.description: Adds a new string block state filter with OR logic.

methods.name: is
methods.description: Advanced condition method with separate method arguments and filter arguments.

parameters.name: methodArgs
parameters.description: Arguments to pass to the helper method (optional/varargs).

parameters.name: filterArgs
parameters.description: Arguments to use for the filter comparison (optional/varargs).

examples:
// Multiple arguments to the filter condition
builder.withBlockFilter("getId").is(["method_args"], ["EQUALS", "minecraft:stone"]);

methods.name: build
methods.description: Creates a WorldScanner instance with the configured filters.
examples:
const scanner = builder.build();
const results = scanner.scanChunksAroundPlayer(2);
